author: Keith Hughitt
title: An Introduction to Git and Github for Scientists

author: Steve Mount
title: FPKM, RPKM, KPKM, TPM, TMM and Other RNA-Seq Normalization Issues

author: Ted Gibbons
title: Understanding the OrthoMCL pipeline
abstract: The OrthoMCL pipeline was introduced over a decade ago and remains one of the most popular approaches for clustering (protein) sequences.  Several variants of the pipeline have since been published, but the major steps remain unchanged.  In this first session, I will explain each step of the OrthoMCL pipeline in detail.

author: Ted Gibbons
title: Effects of graph weighting parameters and inflation values on clustering
abstract: The primary differences between the various flavors of the OrthoMCL pipeline are the metrics used to weight the graph and/or MCL inflation parameter value(s).  The effects of these differences can be very difficult to understand and the corresponding publications provide very little, if any, helpful information.  I have therefore systematically explored the effects of these parameters on clustering a subset of sequences from the euKaryotic Orthologous Groups (KOG) database, simulating the fragmentation that commonly results from modern high-throughput sequencing projects.

author: Will Gammerdinger
title: Prediction of functional variants using SnpEff/SnpSift
abstract: The talk will be a short discussion on using SnpEff/SnpSift to annotate functional variants from genome-wide data sets. It will have a short demonstration to illustrate the flexibility of the software and show what types of variants it can identify.

author: Josie Reinhardt
title: Tools for detecting insertions, deletions, and other CNVs using Illumina data

author: Matt Conte
title: Improving genome assembly with PacBio reads
